topics.content: A computer system consists of hardware, software, data, and users working together.
Hardware refers to the physical parts of a computer such as keyboard, mouse, and monitor.
Software is a set of instructions that tells the computer what to do.
System software controls the computer, while application software helps users perform tasks.
The Internet is a worldwide network of computers that share information.
A web browser is a software used to access websites on the Internet.
Cyber safety means using the Internet responsibly and protecting personal information.
A digital footprint is the information left behind by users while using the Internet.
A word processor is used to create, edit, and format text documents.
Formatting includes changing font size, style, color, and alignment.
A spreadsheet is used to store, organize, and analyze data in rows and columns.
A cell is the intersection of a row and column, and a range is a group of cells.
Formulas are used to perform calculations in spreadsheets.
Programming is the process of writing instructions to make a computer perform tasks.
An algorithm is a step-by-step method used to solve a problem.
A flowchart represents an algorithm using symbols and arrows.
Python is a high-level programming language that is easy to read and write.
Variables store data and data types specify the kind of value stored.
Input is used to take data from the user and output is used to display results.
A web page is a document displayed on a web browser.
HTML is used to create the structure of a web page.
CSS is used to style and improve the appearance of web pages.
